text: durlabha mānava-janma labhiyā saṁsāre
kṛṣṇa nā bhajinu duḥkha kahiba kāhāre?
translation: I attained a human birth, which is most rare in this world, but did not serve Kṛṣṇa. To whom shall I express my sorrow?

text: ‘saṁsāra’ ‘saṁsāra’ kari’ michhe gela kāla
lābha nā ha-ila kichhu, ghaṭila jañjāla
translation: Living life after life in this mundane world, my time has passed in vain. I have not gained anything. I have only suffered.

text: kisera saṁsāra ei chhāyābāji prāya
ihāte mamatā kari vṛthā dina yāya
translation: What sort of world is this? It is like a shadow play. Attaching myself to it, my days pass by in vain.

text: e deha patana ha’le ki rabe āmāra?
keha sukha nāhi dibe putra paribāra
translation: When this body drops dead, what will remain ‘mine’? Upon death neither my sons nor my family will give me any satisfaction.

text: gardabhera mata āmi kari pariśrama
kāra lāgi’ eta kari, nā ghuchila bhrama
translation: I toil laboriously like an ass. For whom am I doing this? Still my illusion has not been dispelled.

text: dina yāya michhā kāje, niśā nidrā-vaśe
nāhi bhāvi maraṇa nikaṭe āchhe vase
translation: My days pass in meaningless labour, and my nights pass in sleep. I never consider that death is sitting nearby.

text: bhāla manda khāi, heri, pari, chintā-hīna
nāhi bhāvi, e deha chhāḍiba kona dina
translation: I eat luxuriously, look around, and dress carelessly, never considering that one day I will leave this body.

text: deha-geha-kalatrādi-chintā avirata
jāgichhe hṛdaye mora buddhi kari hata
translation: Constant thoughts of my body, home, wife, and so on, arise in my heart and spoil my intelligence.

text: hāya, hāya! nāhi bhāvi—anitya e saba
jīvana vigate kothā rahibe vaibhava?
translation: Alas! Alas! I never considered that all of these things are temporary. When my soul departs, where will all these opulences remain?

text: śmaśāne śarīra mama paḍiyā rahibe
vihaṅga-pataṅga tāya vihāra karibe
translation: My body will be laid to rest at the crematorium. There birds and insects will enjoy it.

text: kukkura sṛgāla saba ānandita ha’ye
mahotsava karibe āmāra deha la’ye
translation: Dogs and jackals will happily have a festival with my body.

text: ye dehera ei gati, tāra anugata
saṁsāra-vaibhava āra bandhu-jana yata
translation: This is the fate of my body, its effects, material wealth, and all of my companions.

text: ataeva māyā-moha chhāḍi buddhimāna
nitya-tattva kṛṣṇa-bhakti karuna sandhāna
translation: So, intelligent souls! Abandon Māyā’s illusion and search for the eternal truth: devotion to Kṛṣṇa.
